title: The Wailing Octopus: A Rick Brant Science-Adventure Story

quoteFirst: The _Pelican_ replied with a full broadside and at
quoteLast: a ball struck Captain Allen, hurling him across the deck and tore off one leg. It was a mortal wound, but Allen struggled up till he rested his weight on his elbow and then continued to direct the battle until, after four minutes, he fainted from loss of blood and was carried below.
title: The history of our Navy from its origin to the present day, 1775-1897, vol. 2 (of 4)
author: Spears, John Randolph, 1850-1936

quoteFirst: Neefit did not at once tell him that Moggs was walking with her, but such was the fact. Just at five o'clock Moggs had presented himself at the cottage,--knowing very well, sly dog that he was, the breeches-maker's hour of return, which took place always precisely at
quoteLast: ,--and boldly demanded an interview with Polly. "I should like to hear what she's got to say to me," said he, looking boldly, almost savagely, into Mrs. Neefit's face.
title: Ralph the Heir
author: Trollope, Anthony, 1815-1882
